
# Load the sheet content to inspect its structure

```{python}
import pandas as pd
data = pd.read_excel('data/Export and Import Unit Value Indices 2016 to 2024.xlsx', sheet_name='Export and Import Unit Value In')

```

# Display the first few rows to understand the data

```{python}
import plotly.express as px
data.head(3)
px.histogram(data, y='H04', x=['MO012016', 'MO012023', 'MO012024'])
```

```{python}
#import pandas as pd
#import plotly.express as px

# Truncate function
def truncate_label(label, max_length=10):
    return label[:max_length] + "..." if len(label) > max_length else label

# Apply truncation to the `H05` column
data['H05_truncated'] = data['H05'].apply(lambda x: truncate_label(x, max_length=15))

# Create the histogram
fig = px.histogram(
    data.query('H04 == "Imports"'), 
    y='H05_truncated', 
    x=['MO012016', 'MO012023', 'MO012024'],
    barmode='relative'
)

# Update layout for better readability
fig.update_layout(
    yaxis_title="Shortened H05 Labels",
    xaxis_title="Yearly Values",
    title="Histogram with Truncated Labels"
)

# Show the plot
fig.show()

```
